newsitem.title: SWEDEN: SCA says reducing Industrivarden stake.
newsitem.headline: SCA says reducing Industrivarden stake.

text.p: Swedish forestry group SCA said on Wednesday it would keep reducing its stake in investment company Industrivarden.

"The company has decided to further reduce its stake through issuing, on the international capital market, a five-year promissory note in marks, which can be swapped for shares in Industrivarden," the company said in a statement.
SCA currently holds about 14 percent of votes in Industrivarden after selling shares equivalent to about six percent of votes in December 1995.
The size of the post available for conversion is estimated to correspond to about six percent of votes in the company, SCA said.
In total, SCA will bring down its voting share to about five percent through also reaching an agreement with its pension fund about swapping assets, it said.
SCA will get about 25,000 hectares of forestry holdings and the pension fund will receive Industrivarden shares corresponding to 2.8 percent of votes, the company said.
By swapping assets, SCA will pocket a capital gain of about 125 million crowns which will be accounted for in its first quarter earnings report, due to be released on April 28.
SCA added that its chief executive Sverker Martin-Lof will leave his post on Industrivarden's board.
